The Short NAP: Wednesday 25th April 2007

Apr 24, 2007 Aaron Parker

The Short NAP is a quick list of Microsoft Network Access Protection and Server/Domain Isolation related links from around the web. Here are links for Wednesday the 25th of April 2007:

This edition of the Short NAP is a little earlier than expected as Microsoft has released a number of guides for configuring Network Access Protection in a lab environment. These documents have been around previously but theyâ€™ve been updated and re-released:

  • Step By Step Guide: Demonstrate 802.1X NAP Enforcement in a Test Lab
  • Setting Up Virtual Private Network Enforcement for Network Access Protection in a Test Lab
  • Setting Up Dynamic Host Configuration Protocol Enforcement for Network Access Protection in a Test Lab
  • Setting Up Internet Protocol Security Enforcement for Network Access Protection in a Test Lab

Brian Posey has also added part 6 of his introduction to Network Access Protection:

  • An Introduction to Network Access Protection (Part 6)

UPDATE: Microsoft have also released an update to the Network Access Protection Platform Architecture document:

  • Network Access Protection Platform Architecture
